definitions: having or providing plenty of room or area inside or around something
examples: The spacious apartment had room for all their furniture
We enjoyed the spacious garden with its wide lawns

definitions: covered or decorated with small sparkling objects or bright spots
examples: The star-spangled banner waved in the breeze
Her spangled dress caught everyone's attention at the party

definitions: appearing fresh, clean, and impressively new in condition
used to emphasize that something is very much of its kind
examples: They moved into a spanking new house last month
The car looked spanking clean after the wash
We arrived at a spanking good pace
The spanking fresh breeze invigorated everyone on deck

definitions: using or giving only small amounts to avoid waste or excess
examples: She was sparing with her compliments, making them more meaningful
The chef was sparing with salt in his healthy recipes

definitions: shining brightly with flashes of light or glittering points
showing liveliness, wit, or effervescence in manner or quality
examples: The sparkling water caught the sunlight beautifully
Her sparkling jewelry matched her elegant dress
His sparkling conversation entertained the whole dinner party
The sparkling wine matched her bubbly personality perfectly

definitions: occurring or distributed thinly with considerable spaces between
examples: The sparse vegetation struggled to survive in the desert
Attendance was sparse at the early morning meeting

definitions: showing simplicity and absence of luxury or comfort
examples: His spartan bedroom contained only a bed and desk
They lived a spartan lifestyle focused on essentials

definitions: relating to or occupying space and the relationships within it
examples: Her spatial awareness helped her excel at architecture
The spatial arrangement of furniture improved the room's flow

definitions: able to speak or communicate in a specified language
engaged in or used for verbal communication or expression
examples: The speaking parrot amazed visitors at the zoo
She's a Spanish-speaking nurse at the hospital
We need better speaking skills for public presentations
The speaking role required extensive dialogue memorization

definitions: requiring or involving detailed knowledge or training in particular area
examples: The hospital has specialised equipment for heart surgery
She pursued specialised training in pediatric medicine

definitions: requiring or involving detailed knowledge or training in particular area
examples: The specialized software requires months of training
He works in a specialized field of quantum physics

definitions: clearly identified, stated, or defined in detail
examples: Please arrive at the specified time for your appointment
The contract included all specified terms and conditions

definitions: marked or covered with small spots or patches of color
examples: The speckled eggs were hidden carefully in the nest
Her speckled complexion showed years of sun exposure

definitions: wearing eyeglasses or having markings resembling spectacles
examples: The spectacled professor peered over his thick lenses
The spectacled bear has distinctive white markings around its eyes

definitions: of or like a ghost or phantom in appearance
relating to or produced by a spectrum of light or radiation
examples: A spectral figure appeared in the foggy graveyard
The spectral presence chilled everyone in the old house
Scientists analyzed the spectral data from distant stars
The spectral analysis revealed the material's composition

definitions: based on theory or conjecture rather than firm evidence or knowledge
examples: Her speculative investment in startups proved risky
The article contained mostly speculative claims about the future

definitions: temporarily unable to speak due to strong emotion or surprise
examples: The surprise party left her completely speechless with joy
He stood speechless when he saw the breathtaking view

definitions: happening or moving quickly with rapid progress
examples: We appreciate your speedy response to our request
The speedy recovery surprised even the doctors

definitions: held in complete fascination as if by magic spell
examples: The audience sat spellbound during the magician's performance
Children were spellbound by the storyteller's enchanting tales

definitions: spending money freely and carelessly without thought for future
examples: His spendthrift habits left him broke by month's end
The spendthrift lifestyle couldn't last on her modest salary

definitions: having been used up with nothing remaining or left
drained of energy or strength through exertion or use
examples: The spent fuel rods required careful disposal procedures
All our spent resources went toward the project
She felt completely spent after the marathon race
The spent swimmers collapsed on the beach exhausted

definitions: having the shape of a sphere or ball
examples: The spherical planet rotated slowly on its axis
Water droplets form nearly spherical shapes in zero gravity

definitions: containing strong flavors from spices especially hot ones
having exciting, provocative, or mildly scandalous quality
examples: The spicy curry made everyone reach for water
She loves spicy Mexican food with extra peppers
The spicy gossip spread quickly through the office
His spicy sense of humor kept everyone entertained

definitions: fitted with or having sharp pointed projections
having risen suddenly and sharply to higher level
examples: The spiked fence kept intruders out effectively
He wore spiked shoes for better traction
Sales spiked dramatically during the holiday season
The spiked temperature readings concerned the doctors

definitions: covered with or having many sharp points or spikes
quick to take offense or become irritated
examples: The spiky cactus required careful handling when repotting
Her spiky hair stood up in all directions
His spiky personality made collaboration difficult sometimes
She gave spiky responses when questioned about the mistake

definitions: relating to or affecting the spine or backbone
examples: The spinal injury required immediate medical attention
Spinal alignment is crucial for good posture

definitions: covered with or having many sharp spine-like projections
examples: The spiny sea urchin defended itself with sharp quills
Spiny desert plants evolved to conserve water

definitions: winding in continuous curves that gradually widen or tighten
examples: The spiral staircase led to the tower's top
A spiral galaxy contains billions of stars

definitions: moving in a spiral pattern or continuous curves
increasing or decreasing rapidly in uncontrolled manner
examples: The spiraling smoke rose from the chimney
Eagles were spiraling upward on thermal currents
Spiraling costs forced the project to be cancelled
The spiraling crisis required immediate intervention

definitions: showing great energy, enthusiasm, and determination
examples: The spirited debate lasted well into the night
Her spirited performance earned a standing ovation

definitions: relating to belief in communication with spirits of the dead
examples: The spiritualist medium claimed to contact deceased relatives
Her spiritualist beliefs influenced her worldview significantly

definitions: showing or caused by malice and desire to hurt
examples: Her spiteful comments hurt everyone's feelings unnecessarily
The spiteful gesture was meant to cause embarrassment

definitions: marked or covered with scattered drops or patches of liquid
examples: His splashed clothes showed evidence of the paint job
The splashed canvas created an interesting abstract pattern

definitions: magnificent and impressive in appearance or quality
examples: The splendid palace attracted tourists from around the world
What a splendid idea for solving our problem

definitions: causing severe sharp pain especially in the head
in the process of dividing or separating into parts
examples: She suffered from a splitting headache all afternoon
The splitting pain made concentration impossible
The splitting wood cracked loudly under pressure
They faced the splitting decision of choosing sides

definitions: having deteriorated through decomposition or contamination
harmed in character by being treated too leniently or indulgently
examples: The spoiled milk smelled terrible when opened
We threw out all the spoiled food
The spoiled child threw tantrums when denied anything
Years of spoiled behavior made discipline difficult

definitions: having deteriorated through decomposition or contamination
harmed in character by being treated too leniently or indulgently
examples: The spoilt meat had to be discarded immediately
Check for spoilt ingredients before cooking
The spoilt teenager expected everything handed to her
His spoilt attitude alienated potential friends

definitions: expressed or communicated through verbal speech rather than writing
characterized by particular manner or type of speech
examples: The spoken agreement lacked legal documentation
Spoken language differs from written communication
She's well-spoken and articulate in presentations
The soft-spoken man rarely raised his voice

definitions: soft, porous, and able to absorb liquid like a sponge
examples: The spongy moss felt soft beneath our feet
The cake had a light, spongy texture

definitions: happening naturally without being planned or forced in advance
examples: Their spontaneous trip to the beach was refreshing
The crowd burst into spontaneous applause

definitions: causing fear or unease through being strange or supernatural
examples: The spooky old house creaked in the wind
Strange spooky noises came from the dark basement

definitions: occurring at irregular intervals or in scattered instances
examples: Sporadic gunfire could be heard throughout the night
Her sporadic attendance made it hard to track progress

definitions: connected with or interested in sports and athletic activities
behaving fairly and generously especially in competition
examples: The sporting goods store sold equipment for every sport
His sporting achievements earned him many medals
It was sporting of him to congratulate his opponent
She showed a sporting attitude despite losing

definitions: inclined to play and frolic in lively manner
examples: The sportive puppies chased each other around the yard
Her sportive mood made the party more enjoyable

definitions: having style associated with sports or athletic wear
enjoying or good at sports and physical activities
examples: She wore a sporty outfit to the gym
The sporty car had racing stripes
He's quite sporty and plays tennis every weekend
The sporty family enjoyed outdoor adventures together

definitions: absolutely clean and free from any marks or stains
examples: The spotless kitchen impressed all the dinner guests
She maintained a spotless reputation throughout her career

definitions: marked with round patches of color or texture
having been seen, noticed, or identified
examples: The spotted leopard blended into the dappled shade
She wore a spotted dress to the party
He was spotted leaving the building at midnight
The rare bird was spotted by several observers

definitions: covered with spots or round marks
occurring irregularly or varying in quality or reliability
examples: His spotty complexion cleared up with treatment
The spotty dog had dalmatian ancestry
Their spotty attendance record concerned the teacher
Cell phone coverage was spotty in rural areas

definitions: relating to marriage or to married couples
examples: Spousal support payments were arranged after the divorce
They attended spousal counseling to improve their relationship

definitions: spreading out over large area in untidy or irregular way
examples: The sprawling city extended for miles in every direction
His sprawling handwriting was difficult to read
